website_summaries.verdict: All of the strengths of keypad-based units; few of the flaws of remote keyless entry systems. Proper installation is critical, so don’t hesitate to call customer service.
pros: You can program codes and monitor the lock via smartphone app
Works well with SmartThings and Wink hubs
cons: Unit sucks the battery dry if it operates at high power often or is defective
Installation may require bigger holes drilled in the door to fit properly

website_summaries.verdict: Undoubtedly the best of the best. Offers reliable security and protection, not to mention dependable performance over time.
pros: A top choice for its user-friendly design and compatibility with numerous types of doors

customer_reviews.title: Finish does not last
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this lock. I use it with a smart things hub and that is way cool. The battery life is pretty good, better than expected. The problem is with the oil rubbed bronze finish. 2 years later it is an eye sore. They may work, but the short lived finish makes this a throw away purchase for me. I have attached a photo.
customer_reviews.author: Zoltan Mclovin

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Apart from some faulty units which consume alot of battery, this lock is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: SF

customer_reviews.title: Smart lock that is actually dumb
customer_reviews.text: Installation of the lock is relatively straight forward and it looks nice which is a good start, but.....the app will not connect to the lock! Check out the reviews on the play store, nearly all are 1 star because your new smart lock is actually an expensive dumb lock. I wish schlage would spend a little bit of money to develop an app that works. Until then don't bother with lock or stick with another brand that has an app that works. I could get a Samsung smart hub to pair with the lock but you can't setup anything from the hub, you need the terrible schlage app.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Good luck getting answers!
customer_reviews.text: I am trying to match my configuration with an existing Schlage lock in which the deadbolt failed... because a gaping hole in your door isn't very secure! The Schlage employee I spoke with was rude and less than helpful. She really had no clue, transferred me to someone in FL, who transferred me back to a static line. After being on hold for 20 minutes I gave up.
customer_reviews.author: Katharine

customer_reviews.title: Knob issue in schlage.
customer_reviews.text: The lock is good but when Schlage opens the door it does not turn the knob in the back fully. So when you try to lock it you have to manually move the knob. Please see video for detailed explanation.
customer_reviews.author: Dinesh Mahadevan

customer_reviews.title: Got it working with Google Home/Google Assistant
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with Samsung Smart things hub and Google Assistant. After installation and integration with SmartThings, I realized it wouldn't integrate with Google Assistant...which appears to be a limitation of Google. I integrated IFTTT, and created two applets for locking and unlocking (1 for each). I can now from anywhere, use Google Assistant to lock or unlock this Schlage deadbolt. IFTTT works as a connector between SmartThings and Google Assistant. Surprisingly easy to setup. Setting up this device made me realize how powerful IFTTT can be, and I recommend looking into it.
customer_reviews.author: D.J.

customer_reviews.title: Unable to use this item
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my new home. My contractor installed it for me but the programming never worked. We left it as is by using only the key. We finally moved in last week and tried to program it but it doesn't work. After we key in the default password, the lock tries to close and then it bounces back. The lock can neither lock or unlock with the pin. We already passed the return date to Amazon. Can I get a replacement from the manufacture? Very disappointed. We were hoping to use this with the rest of the smart home accessories with Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: K. Chan

customer_reviews.title: Randomly started to Malfunction after a couple years
customer_reviews.text: Bought three is these to integrate into Z-Wave bridge already in use. Once installed and communicating with Bridge everything seemed to be fine. Two of them are under covered porches and one is only shielded by the soffet on the garage. Now one (that's shaded and covered from weather) has started killing batteries after a couple weeks, randomly sounding alarm in middle of the night, causing Z-Wave scene to activate and start turning lights on all over the house and inside Schlage indicator light stays illuminated now despite being disabled through the App. Disappointed that something this expensive, lasted less than a few years despite being sheltered from the weather.
customer_reviews.author: Danette Young

customer_reviews.title: Move and and Do not waste your Money on this. We use it for 4 years now!
customer_reviews.text: It's about 4 years now we have this lock installed. Recently it starts beeping which is very annoying and makes our dog crazy. Just imagine you are in deep sleep in the middle of the night and your dog starts barking and running around because of this idiot lock start beeping with no reason! I searched online and also went through the manual times to see how mute the bolt, but even after I mute it and replaced the batteries several times it's still beeping. Do not waste your money on this and go and get something else if you do not want to run through the same issue after 4 years!
customer_reviews.author: Martini

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for Prime Time
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two, one from amazon and one from a retail store. I tried installing one and spent most of the day (since it was my first one) messing with it and the samsung hub and never could get it to work. Thinking it could be the zwave on the lock I tried the second one. It installed without any problem. I exchanged the first one and the replacement installed fine. In two days however it failed as well. I contacted Samsung and they sent me a replacement. Since then one of the locks goes on and off line with the hub fairly regular. DLDR: Two locks failed in two days and one is still flaky.
customer_reviews.author: BeachBum

customer_reviews.title: Nice, good looking front door lock
customer_reviews.text: Nice, good looking front door lock. However, in the 3 months since installation, the keypad went unresponsive 4 or 5 times. The only way to get it going again is to disconnect/reconnect the battery. I thought it was the battery the first few times but it wasn't. The keypad just quits and the only way to open the door is use the actual lock key.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick of Alamo, CA

customer_reviews.title: Lock and load
customer_reviews.text: It works well, however I bought this one mainly for the z-wave technology and to be able to connect it to my smart house. I find that getting it to connect to the z-wave hub is a huge pita. I have 2 of these and the only way I was able to get one to connect was to move my hub within a feet or so of it while programming it. You could also try programming it before installing it on your door which is what I should have done.
customer_reviews.author: dreamingat30fps

customer_reviews.title: Read if you want to setup to use remotely
customer_reviews.text: If you want to lock/unlock and or set/change pins remotely you need to purchase a smarthome controler/hub. There are a number of options out there. I tried Samsung Smarthings first for approx $60. Easy setup but only function it gives you is to lock/unlock so i returned it and bought the Vera plus for $100. Had some difficulty getting it to pair initially but their customer support was fantastic and now I can set new pins, lock unlock, and all sorts of other things from anywhere. Its fantastic. I bought this lock not realizing it would need additional hardware to function the way I wanted it to which is why I am sharing this.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Kuczmera

customer_reviews.title: More deceptive advertising
customer_reviews.text: This product promises to work with everyone's software. Just not their own. When I tried to pair with the schlage app, it would not. And the support informed me I had to buy a specific model to use their app. This is crap at the lowest level. Eveyone else has software that will support their z wave devise. Looking to replace already.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: Lock doesn't last. Lasted just over a year before it started to fail. Won't lock or unlock. Changed batteries and did a factory reset and it still doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: cb3431

customer_reviews.title: 2 years of service. Keep your key handy somewhere
customer_reviews.text: Lasted two years before it died for good. Worked like a charm with good rechargeable batteries. Worked so well I got use to leaving the backup key inside. Came home and was locked out. Keypad lights up wont accept code. I've trouble shot it. Factory reset it and no codes will work now. As soon as the 4 numbers are entered it times out and shuts off. Changed batteries and followed all steps it wont come back to life. Luckily someone was home to let me in.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Peguero

customer_reviews.title: AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE
customer_reviews.text: This requires all sorts of hoops and jumps to do anything with it. Doesn't work well with the samsung hub, so a second hub is required if you're using the "normal hub" most people would use (Samsung). What a piece of sh**. Customer support at Schlage is very helpful, but they couldn't help with the Samsung hub (which took four two-hour phone calls due to their horrible wait times and unbelievably unhelpful people. Get anything *but* the Connect, which requires a (recommended Samsung) hub within 10' of the lock. Don't purchase the Samsung; it's a trainwreck of a software, now in its third iteration that doesn't update usernames, passwords, and requires an entire rebuild of any devices connected to it.
customer_reviews.author: A Usually-Happy Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable z-wave operation solved
customer_reviews.text: The lock is good quality and works well as a keyless lock. However the zwave connectivity was initially unreliable. It reported unknown status multiple times a week and required a complete reset almost monthly. Other devices in the network work fine. October 2018 update: I added a zwave repeater and it worked fine for a little over two weeks, was looking promising, but then showed unavailable status and stopped responding to network commands for extended periods (e.g. a day). Noticed issues with the deadbolt closing and readjusted for smoother operation. Unit now maintains z-wave connection.
customer_reviews.author: DaveJ

customer_reviews.title: Great lock - paired with a WINK hub (the original ...
customer_reviews.text: Great lock - paired with a WINK hub (the original / cheap one) and works great. I'm able to change the codes on it from my phone from 5 states away.... TIP: if you install the lock and its giving an error or running "backwards", just do a factory reset on it (in the instructions, very simple - i believe you plug the battery in with the Schlage button pressed and held for several seconds) and it will work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Parrow

customer_reviews.title: Louder than expect, but very, very secure -- and cool.
customer_reviews.text: The installation went flawlessly. The pairing process -- per the instructions -- took a bit longer. A bit of common sense had to be used. Now that the device is paired, I am able to include it in a number of home automation processes. PROs: - Simple installation; - Simplicity in use; - Size of screws included for install are far superior that normal entry deadbolts. CONs: - The level of noise the device makes when locking/unlocking -- I expected a more silent operation; - The size of the interior door mechanism -- it's big...really big...and black, so it stands out...
customer_reviews.author: Eric H.

customer_reviews.title: Smart really means dumb
customer_reviews.text: Beware if the model number contains 469 you will not be able to pair with the Sense App. In fact Schlage even says so on their answer dot schlage dot com page. Model with 469 are only meant for Zwave controllers. Guess what? That doesn’t work either. Basically you just get a lock with a nice keypad that doesn’t do everything it’s supposed to do. I should have researched more. Shame on me
customer_reviews.author: Mark E Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Convenient access but beware of batteries
customer_reviews.text: I like not having to rummage through my pockets to pull out a key. Most of the time. Within a month, the batteries ran down and I had to do exactly that to open the door and get into the house. Either keep a key with you or change the batteries on a regular schedule to avoid that embarrassment. I had no difficulty setting up the access codes after installing the lock. The most troublesome part of the installation was connecting the battery pack cable to the connector on the board. The fit was very tight and it would not go in properly.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Works great - seamless install.  Be sure you understand the difference between Sense and Connect
customer_reviews.text: This is my second BE469 CEN 622 - I needed the Z-wave enabled model. Ordered one a few weeks ago and although unopened and brand new, the gears were grinding and after reading on a few forums there was a bad batch or two - apparently I got one. Waited on their support number for over an hour, got frustrated, and returned it. Bought another one (identical) and it installed perfectly with no issues. Be sure you get the right one - there are so many models of this Schlage lock - the big difference is the Connect (Z-wave - works with home security systems) and the Sense (Bluetooth - works with Apple Homekit - which is terrible).
customer_reviews.author: hgpilot - MM

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to connect to Samsung smartthings hub
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these locks. Trying to connect to a smarthings hub, latest version. NO GO. Ive followed 5 different sets of directions from others having the same issues and it will not connect. Ive reset them, tried z-wave exclusion etc. NOTHING will make it pair up. The hub is inches away, that's not the issue. I press the schlage button, enter my program code, then 0, and it flashes yellow for about 10 seconds and gives me a red X. Everytime. If they fix the issue I will update my review. Until then- stay away!!!! Ill be returning these.
customer_reviews.author: D Rodeo L

customer_reviews.title: Keypad Failure
customer_reviews.text: Product works great ... until it doesn't. This is the second one I've had the keypad fail which makes the lock useless for granting 3rd parties key code entry into the house. The lock can still be controlled by Nexia app, but that doesn't help as I need to make keys for everyone that comes into the house. What's the point?
customer_reviews.author: Scott Wainner

customer_reviews.title: battery died without warnings.
customer_reviews.text: super disappointed in the lock. i've had it for 2 months and one week and i stepped outside to grab the mail and it died - couldn't get back in. i had to pay $150 to a locksmith to get me in through another door and when i was in, replaced the batteries and it's working again. the system never informed me that the batteries were low and quite frankly, they shouldn't be after 2 months of usage. super unacceptable for such an expensive love.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: First one failed after a year of use BUT, Schlage reimbursed/no hassle!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this lock (not using the Alexa or any smart features) and loved it. Then I went to leave one evening and when I hit the lock button all I I got was an X and the door would'nt lock (lucky me). I thought the batteries failed but after changing them twice the lock still wouldn't cooperate. I called Schlage the next morning to see about trouble shooting but they said just buy another and email the receipt and they would send a gift card for the replacement value without having to send the lock back to them. So, I purchased another same day delivery via Amazon and am very happy. I just hope the new one doesn't fail?
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable enough for a single point of entry
customer_reviews.text: This lock will stop functioning randomly every few months. I have to disconnect the batteries and reconnect them to make it work again. This doesn't seem like a big deal, except that if it happens when you are out of the house, it is not possible to get back in without a key. So, you have to carry a key anyway, and there's no point in having this lock. It usually works, but you can't trust it to let you back into your home.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Going for 6 months on high-power mode with same batteries
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this for 6 months with a Samsung SmartThings Hub and it's worked great. There was one unnecessary step in the installation instructions but that probably just depends on your existing setup. Installation was pretty easy and I have very limited experience with door locks. I am surprised that the battery is still going because it runs in high power mode for us due to a slight misalignment with the door jam. It locks and unlocks every time, though. Very happy
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Application is not good
customer_reviews.text: Why did I give one Star Only? The Lock is an excellent lock, however the application never connects to the Lock. The main reason why I bought this Lock is because the Smart Capabilities. It will connect to the Wink Hub, however you cannot add users and set codes to those user from The wink app. This can only be done via de Schalage Sence App. Please take a look at The ratings of this app in the app store at least for the Android. So, I am considering in returning This Lock just for that reason, if I wouldn't be interested in the Smart Capabilities of this Lock then I could obtain a regular lock.
customer_reviews.author: Delphimpd

customer_reviews.title: I think every real estate agent should consider gifting this to their clients as a closing gift
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for about 4 years now.. I've replaced the batteries 3 times.. being able to lock and unlock your door smoothly without any effort will make a big difference on battery when we first got the lock we had to push the door a tiny bit to make it smooth and that made a difference in the lock so we adjusted the setting so that there was no resistance and have never had a problem since and that was for years ago.. I can honestly say this is my absolutely most favorite purchase for my new home. Slowly we've added a lot of automation to the house but nothing is as useful as this lock has been.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Alexa without an added $150+ Hub
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed in this product, the marketing and advertising of it from Schlage - Terrible! If you don't want to hook it to Alexa or other hub, it was very easy to install and works great with codes. I can add codes and remove them fairly easily. They do have a model that is the same price that does work with alexa - it has to have a Zigbee lock. Then it will work with only a certain type of alexa product and ap. I did the research and STILL with the bad advertising bought this one. Beyond annoyed!
customer_reviews.author: Sheridan

customer_reviews.title: Really nice electronic deadbolt
customer_reviews.text: Had it about a month and so far it’s been working great. Doesn’t see a ton of use as this is on a front door and entry is usually via the garage in the rear. Still, it’s really nice to be able to go in the front door any time you want. Usually, I had to walk around back because I never carry a key. Now, it’s just a matter of walking up and punching in your code. So far, holding up well and has functioned flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: The Magician

customer_reviews.title: NOT for cold or humid climates.
customer_reviews.text: “At Schlage, we know security”... Well guys, at Schlage you don’t know humidity. The first lock worked fine until it got colder in the fall, for about a month. The replacement was working for a couple of months, then slowly started to die as well.
customer_reviews.author: AnonymousReviewer

customer_reviews.title: No problems and good battery life
customer_reviews.text: This lock has been working flawlessly since I installed it nine months ago. We are a family of four, so the lock gets a lot of use. The batteries lasted nine months before they needed replaced. Like the instructions very clearly point out, good alignment between the door/lock and the hole in the strike plate is critical for proper operation. If you have to push or pull on the door to lock and unlock the door, it's not going to be able to function properly, especially when controlled wirelessly using ZWave. This should be obvious and is not a fault of the product, but many reviewers complained about it.
customer_reviews.author: Computer Dude

customer_reviews.title: Convenient when it works properly.
customer_reviews.text: I had this installed in my previous house without problems. It's very convenient, but I did not like having to buy an additional piece of electronics (I got the "SmartThings Hub") to use an app to lock/unlock the door. I took it with me when I moved and its not working correctly after being installed again. According to the FAQs it is an alignment issue, but when using the keys it locks and unlocks smoothly. Rating 4 stars since I'm going to need to mess around with it to get it working properly again, and for needing an additional device to use all the features.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for AirBnB rentals.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this lock however I wish the batteries would last longer when used with smartthings controller. Fit and finish is perfect, we own two of these and have found them to be durable and high quality. I wrote some simple code to notify me when the batter is low and that has greatly reduced the problem of them running out of batteries. We use them for our AirBnB rentals. Having codes we can easily change and give out to guests is excellent because they can't loose the keys and there is no worry of them copying a key or breaking in later as I can change the code after they leave.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I use this Z-wave lock in concert with my SmartThings hub and it works great. Other users have commented that entry codes can't be remotely managed with this unit, but they actually can through the SmartThings phone app. I've been using it for over a month and the battery pack still reports 100% full. On top of function, the unit looks very nice with the other rubbed bronze hardware on the outside of the home.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: GREAT! For 2.5 years. Now...no longer great.
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well for 2.5 years, but recently started having issues. Battery Life: I've replaced the batteries maybe 3-5 times in 2.5 years. Absolutely reasonable battery life. Samsung SmartThings connectivity: I was easily able to connect to the Samsung SmartThings Hub, which has provided all the functionality & cross-connectivity with Alexa/Google that I need. Trouble: Starting about 3 months ago or so, the lock started to have issues with the keypad. The keypad would become completely unresponsive - no lights, no response, nothing. I have to reset the batteries (basically a "hard reset), and then the device would start working again. It's now at the point where I have to perform this reset nearly weekly for continuous operation.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon O'Very

customer_reviews.title: Connected easily to my Abode security system and allows me keyless ...
customer_reviews.text: Connected easily to my Abode security system and allows me keyless entry and exit to my house. With automations I can have it automatically lock after I leave. Was a little confusing to install at first - if your tailpiece (flat part that sticks all the way through the deadbolt to lock and unlock it) doesn't line up properly, you just have to turn the motorized circle with a lot of force. We were afraid to do so, fearing it would break the lock, until we contacted support and they clarified that it's designed to do this.
customer_reviews.author: t

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 12 months
customer_reviews.text: So we were never able sync the lock with Alexa, or track any of the things we were hoping to (being able to see which combination was used, being able to lock with the app, etc). But we had already disassembled the door and installed this one so just kept it. It worked fairly well but has now completely stopped working after only 12 actual months of use, which seems pretty ridiculous, particularly given the price. My partner bought the Shlague Camelot keypad deadbolt lock and 6 years later it still works great. This is incredibly disappointing and I cannot recommend this lock. Go with the Camelot.
customer_reviews.author: Jean M. Koelsch

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Buttons are a good size for anyone to use. Easy one touch lock. Easy to install. A little hard to figure out how to use additional features, but they were not really required for our needs. Batteries did get a little low around the one year mark, and we needed to use the key just that once. Luckily left it with a trusted neighbor. After that just made sure to change the batteries once a year and never had an issue. Made it really nice when relatives or friends would arrive when we were at work. Great system. Buying several for our new place.
customer_reviews.author: Trisandra Lunanova

customer_reviews.title: Very easy set up, nice features, not overly complicated, only comes with 1 key
customer_reviews.text: Really like this new lock. The styling is similar to the one I had and is very elegant. Like how lock is grade 1 so is hard for someone to pick, unlike many other smart locks on the market. The instal time was very quick, which was important since it's very cold where I live. This was much easier than the Samsung smart lock and would buy again. The one downside would be that it only came with one key, where as Schlage locks normally come with 3 keys for their locks, for $200 I do not see why it did only come with 1.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great product that works with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Cool. I use this lock with my Echo. I needed to buy the Samsung Smart Things hub to allow Alexa to communicate with the lock. It will not only lock the door for you, but it will also check to see if the door is locked. This helps when you're snug in your bed and don't want to get up.
customer_reviews.author: Deek5

customer_reviews.title: Ordered Century; however Retailer shipped me a Camelot
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a Century lock set; however the Retailer shipped me a Camelot lock. I have 14 Century locks through out my hotel in Nicaragua. When I finally received the lock in April, the return window had closed. I thoroughly reviewed my order and I definitely ordered a Century lock; however in error at the warehouse the Retailer shipped me a Camelot. i am sure the lock is fine. It just does not match the style of any of my other locks, so I cannot use it. If the Retailer would exchange for the correct lock, then I would give this sale a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Heath A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: but so far just having a key pad and automatic lock has been awesome. We use it for garage door
customer_reviews.text: I haven't set up for wireless access yet, but so far just having a key pad and automatic lock has been awesome. We use it for garage door, so when coming in with groceries or babies you don't have to fumble to get a key out. The safety feature of having the door lock automatically is a great feature with kids. Once they figure out door knobs the danger of them going of the house is real. So many great features to this lock I'm sure it will fit your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Adam C.

customer_reviews.title: works with smartthings, but it's not clear that you've actually connected it
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of people that have said they couldn't get it to work with smartthings. I thought I was one of those people. I couldn't get it to connect, just said searching. Finally went to reboot everything and noticed it had connected, it just didn't show that it had in the app until I stopped "searching for device". Also, mine connected with my hub about 12' away. In the manual it will say to try connecting BEFORE you install it, but I missed that part, so don't miss it. Again, luckily my hub is pretty close to my door.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Great technology
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. The installation would have been super easy except for the guide they provided to show you where to put holes that wasn't clearly explained that you should not use it if you are using the backings. So, I placed a couple extra holes in my drywall. Other than that, this product was easy to install, easy to set up, and works great.
customer_reviews.author: reviews4

customer_reviews.title: Great smart lock - Abode integration too
customer_reviews.text: This lock is really durable and has a great battery life. Over a year of consistent use and still using the original set of batteries. I also love the integration with my home Abode security/smart system. Did I remember to lock the front door? Doesn't matter, it locks itself when I arm the security system! Or I can check on it from my phone. Syncing with z-wave can be a bit of an issue. Just follow the typical z-wave rule. Exclude it first, then include it in your network. The only thing missing from this lock was a door ajar sensor. Would have given it 5 stars if it had that too.
customer_reviews.author: Homebrew

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product.
customer_reviews.text: This is the Zwave model. You need a compatible smart hub like SmartThings, Wink, Abode, etc to work. This is an awesome GRADE 1 commercial deadbolt. it feels so much heavier and stronger than the Kwikset I almost bought that was only Grade 2. This was worth the price. I highly recommend and plan on buying additional ones for my home. It was very easy to pair with Abode and works instantly when I disarm my home alarm.
customer_reviews.author: M. B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Lock - Would replace my Kwickset one with it if cost was not an issue
customer_reviews.text: I have both the Kwickset deadbolt and this Schlage deadbolt. This item is built much better. Things like the strikeplates and long screws that are included make this lock seem very secure. I really like the "alarm" features and should be a good deterrent should someone tamper with your lock or kick in your door. I use this with a 2Gig alarm system and it works seamlessly. I connected it close to my panel before installing it in a door. This unit never falls out of my network. I can not say the same for my Kwickset. When I try to access this lock from the panel or Alarm.com interface, it always come up. My Kwickset one does not.
customer_reviews.author: Diamond Dog

customer_reviews.title: No App Support
customer_reviews.text: This stand alone system has no app support to access all of it's features. It's like Schlage built this supper great lock, and now one knows how to use it, or access it's features. I paired it up with Samsung SmartThings and all you could do is lock, and unlock via remote access. You can't assign codes, control codes, temp usage... You can, but you need to basically hack the system through instructions that you follow on a support forum "Lock Master". I'm just really surprised that Schlage has not teamed up with August, Nest, or even Samsung with a full featured downloadable app. Very Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: D. E. Hollenbeck

customer_reviews.title: Batteries dead within 12 hours
customer_reviews.text: Install went ok.. the batteries that came in the box died within 12 hours of installation.. luckily had additional batteries.. Hope it was batteries and not a bad unit... Will update later.. at this point only 3 stars. Update: Batteries died again.. requested a replacement.. downgraded to 2 stars for now. Will update with new one. Replacement came and thought the problem was solved.. approx. 2 weeks later dead with the same problem.. Replaced batteries once more and this time within 20 minutes claimed low batteries. Amazon replacing it for a third time, lets hope this works.. Downgrading to 1 star to help people avoid similar issues.
customer_reviews.author: Davé

customer_reviews.title: very good product
customer_reviews.text: The Schlage Connect Lock was very easy to install. Plenty of how-to videos are available. I also bought the Schlage Connect Wi Fi Hub and after countless attempts to "pair it" unsuccessfully, I finally got through to customer service. He immediately told me that the hub I bought will not work and I needed either a Wink, Samsung or Iris hub for it to work. Bought a Wink hub and it works flawlessly, with my phone and Alexa. Very good product!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Nagel

customer_reviews.title: It is OKAY at best....
customer_reviews.text: We had an older lock (almost 20 years old) that used a fob or keypad to open up the lock. Very very handy when your hands were full..... HOWEVER with this lock it is new, that is it. No wireless fob to open the door, only a key or number pad. Could have purchased this 20 years ago... I thought it would be better with now a day technology. I would not buy one again and have considered going back to my older unit which in my opinion is better.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Butler

customer_reviews.title: My family loves it, some room for improvement.
customer_reviews.text: Great and secure Lock. Smaller issues: Integrated alarm is too sensitive, opted for disabling. Auto-close is limited to 30 seconds, it's just not enough time. Attempted to connect with my Samsung smartthings but have not succeeded there yet - you can create a customer time to close with IFTTT. I recommend hiring the Amazon installation because my door fell into the 5% or less of cases that you need extra help to fit it in.
customer_reviews.author: Cliente Kindle

customer_reviews.title: Love the features!
customer_reviews.text: I have never installed any sort of lock before. The previous lock was actually a classic Schlage, not sure if that made this any easier. I had it in and working in about 30 minutes. Make sure to read the book on the programming codes! I now can remotely control this lock using my Samsung SmartThings Hub. Also shows battery life! Love this lock, will be buying more for my other door.
customer_reviews.author: CC37

customer_reviews.title: Terrific product, we can use multiple codes for our ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrific product, we can use multiple codes for our family members, plus it integrates with our SmartThings apps so we can lock door remotely if/when our kids forget to push the button to lock the door. Automation that is supposed to unlock the door when it senses my smart phone works maybe 70% of the time, but not a big deal, it's just a 4 digit code when that happens. SmartThings app also shows battery life so we will know when we need to change the batter. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Tod Y.

customer_reviews.title: HARDWARE GOOD, APP INTERFACE WITH SMART THINGS AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the lock and the look is 5 stars, but as mentioned by others, when connected to the Z wave Smart Things, the only thing you can do is lock and unlock. I was hoping I could ADD AND DELETE user codes from my cell phone app. UPDATE after owning it for one month. SMART THINGS updated their SMART THINGS app, and now I am very happy that under SMART LOCKS, I can add user codes, rename user codes, and DELETE user codes. I can also check the battery life. This is exactly what I needed for my vacation rental, with people coming and going all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected, but not 100%
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for all of our condo units in 2017. I was a bit leery, but most of them continue to work. We've only changed the batteries once. 2 of the keypads have stopped working, but the lock can still be opened with a key and the automatic lock feature still works. We did have them installed by a locksmith and it took about 20 minutes for each installation.
customer_reviews.author: Louise Richards

customer_reviews.title: I have 5 o these and really like them, but the last one installed in December ...
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 of these and really like them, but the last one installed in December and it's malfunctioning. I called for support form Schlage but after holding on for 24 minutes and listening to the terrible music, I gave up. I will buy again though, because these work great. I just changed form 5 to 1 star - because it's a disgrace that I cannot return/exchange this after it before two ful months, and the mnf is unavailable.
customer_reviews.author: J Socal

customer_reviews.title: Best Smart home lock .. 5 minute install and SmartThings compatible.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to start out with a Smartlock in my new house. This has been a breeze to install and setup in Samsung SmartThings hub. Gives me all the details and full control from my ST Hub v2 hub. Very well built, looks like it will last awhile. Very happy with Schlage products, always have been a fan of their locks. A+ for design and reliability If you are on the fence reading this. Just buy it you won't be disappointed. No extra fees for full control of the lock.
customer_reviews.author: Pete from Cali

customer_reviews.title: Works Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I had first seen this lock on a rental house and automatically wanted it for my home. The lock works and looks great. has a lot of features. One thing to be aware of is that if you want to integrate this with a home system like Alexa you will need to buy a smart hub to make the connection. there are many offered on Amazon. This isn't all bad because it does the primary job of linking your lock to your system and phone, but it will also pick up other smart products in your home. I love the lock and its well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Timothy M. schweikert

customer_reviews.title: Great smart lock!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lock about a year ago to make it easier for pet sitters to get in and out of the house without worrying about a key. At first I was concerned about some reviews that claimed the battery died very quickly, but I've only had to replace them once every six months and it warns you well in advanced with an alarm before the battery dies. Although the lock can be programmed by itself as a standalone device, I also paired it with my Wink smarthome hub. Once everything is setup, this makes it easier to program new codes and open the door with your phone without having to fiddle with the lock.
customer_reviews.author: Akeem Mclennon

customer_reviews.title: Does Schlage even QA these units anymore?
customer_reviews.text: I have a few of these and haven't had issues in the past, but I think I need to write a review now from the recent order I placed. I was sent a defective unit that works, but makes very loud grinding noises (I know this because I have others of this same model that don't do this). I talked to customer service to get a replacement and received the new one after around a month and it has the same issue (a little bit quieter, but barely... I didn't even bother sending this one back, what's the point). This was my 4th unit for my last external door, but I wouldn't recommend people buying.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Good security, Z wave connectivity is terrible
customer_reviews.text: Works well, it has trouble staying connected to z wave smartthings hub.. If you have to re-pair it it’s the most annoying process and takes forever Update 1/25/2020 For the millionth time now, the darn Z Wave does not stay connected.. it’s the most annoying thing. I can never see who’s accessing my house. I have to forcefully use the 30 second auto lock which is never enough time to do anything like throw the trash.. the lock itself works great but so did my old lock... Just remember z Wave is trash........
customer_reviews.author: A. Bordonada

customer_reviews.title: Well made product !
customer_reviews.text: I waited for few months before writing review to be sure. The installation was fine if you are a handy man since it requires some mechanical expertise. From my experience, I suggested to connect z-wave first and check the communication before installing it. It took me couple hours to align the latch for the motor to move freely. Also, it did not work properly at first and the customer service helped me to reset it. It has been working flawlessly and our family love the convenient of not carrying the key any more. I can remotely operate the lock with my cell phone and set up routine to lock the door every night in case we forget.
customer_reviews.author: handson

customer_reviews.title: it works as a great lock. i just now need to find a ...
customer_reviews.text: this works as stated as a door lock works with schlage app - NO - schlage sense is the app, it does not see schlage connect models works with apple homekit - NO - there was no barcode to scan works with smartthings - NO. it would not register but otherwise, it works as a great lock. i just now need to find a hub that works with it
customer_reviews.author: J A - San Jose, CA

customer_reviews.title: Quality issue and lack of customer support
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lock in October 2018. Now, January of 2019, the touch panel stopped working. At first, I thought it was battery problem. Replacing new battery did not solve the issue. I have to assume it is the quality issues of the touch panel. I called Schlage customer service numbers, twice. Each time, I gave up after 20 minutes of listening to music..... Then, I wrote email to the customer support with detailed description of quality issues and purchasing invoice. Till now, I have yet to receive a response from Schlage. Very unsatisfactory experience, to say the least!
customer_reviews.author: Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Great when it works or you may get locked out of your house
customer_reviews.text: Pros: convenient, looks nice on a door, and works with Smart Things controls Cons: loud (when locking/unlocking), the touch pad stopped working suddenly 8 months after purchase. I had high hopes for this product, which is very nice when it works. Unfortunately, one day the touch pad suddenly stopped responding, meaning if you didn't have a physical key or your phone/app on you, you'd be locked out of your house. One of the best features is the keypad, so I don't have to carry a key on me or always have my phone. I now always have to remember to have my phone on me in case this happens again.
customer_reviews.author: JustAnotherShopper

customer_reviews.title: Good lock. Needs to be just a tad smarter.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Almost exactly what I wanted. First off, the installation was a total breeze. Second, it works so great. Third though, I was curious how I would be able to remote the lock off site. Well, that doesn’t appear to be a thing for this lock. It still works so well and I have codes set for cleaners, parents, etc... it’s a good lock.
customer_reviews.author: naseth

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe the absolute abomination of trash that someone actually gave the "OK" on sending this to someone. The entire keylock assembly (see the hardest part to reassemble) was entirely disassembled. The instructions have NO INFORMATION on this portion which leads me to believe that my "new product" was refurbished after someone else returned it without all the parts. Hardware bag was already open, and missing crucial parts for reassembly of the, for some reason, disassembled lock. I am in disbelief i paid nearly $200 and got a pile of literal trash that cannot even be reassembled. Waste of time and energy. Do not buy this unless you hate yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Landon Webster

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Connect Directly to Alexa / Echo Plus
customer_reviews.text: Installation was easy, as well as setting up individual codes for the family. This was touted as “works with Alexa” but I would say this is very misleading: it well not hook up directly to the Echo Plus, but it can be controlled via Alexa if you have a separate Wink or Phillips hub. That’s relatively useless to me, as I purchased the Echo hub as it was touted as being able to connect blah blah blah.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Awsome, just Awsome!
customer_reviews.text: This is great. Just make sure you have your deadbolt slot lined up perfectly so that it locks first time every time. Added the Samsung smarthub and arrival sensor so when I get home and have arm loads of groceries or something, the door unlocks, no fumbling with keys. When leaving, just pull the door and hit the button and hear it lock for you. It's great. I can check if it's locked or unlocked from my phone. I can unlock it from anywhere if I need to let someone in.
customer_reviews.author: HFL

customer_reviews.title: Lock is ok but wifi connection is shaky at best.
customer_reviews.text: The lock itself is fine; good quality device. I wanted to have a smart lock so I could check on it when I travel. It functions properly about half the time, give or take, and I have a very well connected home network (GB fiber, Orbi mesh router setup, Samsung Smart Things Hub within about 15 feet of the door). It's ok, and I'm guessing things will get better over time, but for now I'm a bit underwhelmed.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Short-lived but nice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace one I had already. It only last for about a year and a half, then the electronics started going sour (worked sometimes then just started beeping and opening and closing the lock at will). More than once I arrived to a dead screen and had to hunt down the key I left with neighbors. It looks good and when it is new, it's a good lock. For the price, I would have expected a longer life span, but I've become spoiled with the auto-lock feature, so I pay up.
customer_reviews.author: Musette

customer_reviews.title: Can someone please tell me what the correct position of ...
customer_reviews.text: Can someone please tell me what the correct position of the turning pin motor (I'm just going to call it that) so that it's not too far left or right (yes, I get that center would be the logical response) and it doesn't fight me when I attempt to manually lock it. ALSO, I've attempted to turn off the option to not allow it to unlock by simply pressing the schlage button at the top, but it doesn't seem to want to stay off...
customer_reviews.author: dj kaz

customer_reviews.title: I’m also very disappointed that the new deadbolt is smaller than the old ...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been really impressed with this brand per how well it is made and the thought that goes into the assembly. I am replacing a Schlage deadbolt with this electric schlage deadbolt. However, this was difficult to get setup. The video left out a key start for the instructions. The written instructions weren’t clear and actually misleading in how to get started. Finally got it figured out after spending 15-20 minutes of rereading the instructions and watching 3 different YouTube videos. I’m also very disappointed that the new deadbolt is smaller than the old one. Not sure why they reduced the mass other than it is now battery driven?
customer_reviews.author: J. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was our first into the "smart technology" field. We were attracted to it because of its looks. Other than the electronic keypad, the lock looks more like a traditional lock than other brands. The ability to use a traditional physical key is great, though we have been using the lock for about a year and have not used the physical key ones. I love being able to unlock the device from my phone and also using Alexa to control the lock. Battery life is outstanding. With nearly a year's worth of use, the battery is down to 57%. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Michael E Vierling

customer_reviews.title: Can't get it to connect
customer_reviews.text: I can't get this to connect and I even had to buy Samsung IOT, I don't feel like calling and going thru all the trouble of dealing with hooking it up. I guess I should, I just hate having to do all that, it should JUST WORK OUT OF THE BOX, how hard is that?
customer_reviews.author: johnnyboy

customer_reviews.title: Almost a year and works great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 and it has been almost a year now and they work perfectly, never a problem. I use it with the Wink 2 home hub and am notified when ever it is opened if desired. No rust or anything so far. I had to replace batteries on the front door one, but I have that one set to auto lock after 30 seconds so it works more often than the other one. I would stay away from anything brass as brass tends to rust easier than brushed chrome or nickel.
customer_reviews.author: Joi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lock set
customer_reviews.text: I have had good luck with battery life. Perhaps about 6 months with very regular use. This lock has worked very well and integrates with the ring alarm system too. Very nice feature. I have switched off its integration with Alexa though. I dont need her in my lock business.
customer_reviews.author: DoctorMasterBlaster

customer_reviews.title: Great and Easy Install / Use
customer_reviews.text: I'd select 5 start if only there were a SmartThings hook that allowed for Code and Access Auditing capabilities. Not being a Locksmith I was nervous about installation. Was I surprised when it took 30 mins per lock to install and have working with the first code set up. Programming is easy and how nice to never need to hunt for a key again. I give each person a unique code and then can control access (add, remove, change,,,,,) I also get push alerts whenever the locks are opened, closed. Built in Tamper alarm for the lock and the door. Great for securing home.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell BellTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Homeassistant and Z-Stick
customer_reviews.text: Works great with home assistant and z-stick. Make sure you Add-Secure for it to work. I was able to program the codes via Hass and everything. The first one I bought was a kwikset, because I liked that it didn't have a keypad so it looked like a generic deadbolt. I returned that one because the locksmith showed me how he just opens them really easy and replaces the drum when they need to be opened. Turns out I ended up digging the keypad, because it is off until you press something, and it actually looks neat.
customer_reviews.author: Cool Story

customer_reviews.title: These locks were great until recently but the new Schlage app crashes
customer_reviews.text: These locks were great until recently but the new Schlage app crashes. You will be disappointed if you buy a Schlage connect because it will not connect to your app.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: [Update: Yale works fine now too] Fantastic battery life, unlike Yale's
customer_reviews.text: I have several Z-Wave Yales (Real Living Keyless) and several Z-Wave Schlages (Connect Century), and the difference in battery life is astounding. I've had the locks for over a year, all connected to my Qolsys alarm panel through Z-Wave, and I've yet to dip below 70% on the Schlages (without having ever changed out the batteries), yet I have to swap out the batteries on the Yales roughly once a month. It's truly sad, and I'm getting really fed up with the Yale locks, wish I never purchased them. Update: I've sorted out my issues with the Yale lock by updating to a newer panel (Qolsys IQ Panel 2) and adding even more Z-Wave nodes.
customer_reviews.author: Artem Russakovskii

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lock
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should. We purchased a Wink 2 Hub for our home so we could run this via wifi rather than bluetooth. This lock and the Wink system work well together. You can program key codes from your phone app, lock and unlock the door, and also see who's been going in and out (by seeing which key codes were used). This lock was part of our first step of creating a smart home (smart smoke alarms, thermostat, door lock, alarm system, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: Double A

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, good integration with SmartThings, but noisy operation.
customer_reviews.text: Installation was straight forward and not much different than installing a normal deadbolt. Alignment of the bolt is very important. If your current deadbolt sticks at all you’ll probably need some additional work to get it operating smoothly. The only real quibbles I have is the inability to change the auto lock time, 30 seconds was too quick for us. I overcame that by using a door sensor and auto lock app from SmartThings. The other complaint I have is the motor is a bit loud. I came here it from the outside from more than 150 feet away. Indoors you can here it in every room in the House.
customer_reviews.author: SonnyB

customer_reviews.title: I love this Lock
customer_reviews.text: I love this Lock. It met all my expectations and works exactly as I expected. Easy to install in replacing previous Schlage Lock. I had to enlarge the sliding lock part but that took only a few minutes. Locks locks every time and works perfectly with Alexa, Smartthings hub and IFTTT. GREAT quality, nice finish, well made. I feel much more secure knowing my lock is locked and locking itself is great. Haven’t tried all the features yet but so far it was well worth the time and expense.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Merenkov

customer_reviews.title: Haven't figured out how to set codes remotely, otherwise great.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I've had it 3 months and down to 99% battery, with light duty use every day. I use SmartThings to control and monitor. My only complaint is that I cannot set the codes or do anything complex (like scheduling, etc.) through SmartThings as I was led to believe. But that's more a limitation of ST from what I can tell. Others who have HomeSeer w/ addin seem to be able do this.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer_Scott

customer_reviews.title: Deceived... this needs extra hub for alexa
customer_reviews.text: Feel deceived by this product saying its alexa-compatible with a "hub", and my echo plus claims to be a "hub"... but they still don't work together without buying ANOTHER "hub". Now find out a new version replaced this and it sells for same price on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Brendon T

customer_reviews.title: Working great after 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this lock in service for almost two years now. No problems at all. The first set of batteries lasted over a year. It used to have problems communicating with the hub sometimes, but this seems to have cleared up. You must make absolutely sure that the bolt moves into the lock on the door frame with no resistance at all. Make adjustments if you have to. I even widened the lock hole slightly with a Dremel just to make sure there was no rubbing.
customer_reviews.author: woodchuck64

customer_reviews.title: Poor Zwave connection
customer_reviews.text: If you want a really expensive keypad deadbolt that intermittently works with Alexa, then this is the product for you. I purchased three of these units to put on my cabin. I also purchased the recommended SmartThings Hub. Two of the locks. <50’ from the hub intermittently connect. The third @75’ will not connect. I have tried moving the hub, adding repeaters, It would have been cheaper to pay the neibor to check the door locks all year.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Sends you messages saying deadbolt is jammed when deadbolt is not jammed. Even when you lock it manually, the app will still say it's unlocked. At this point I find this product useless since it's supposed to help me lock/unlock door remotely. So frustrated!!! Unfortunately we purchased this in April and gave it to a door manufacturer to put on our custom made door, which was installed today -- so I'm only finding out that this product is defective 6-days after the returnable date!
customer_reviews.author: NL

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on a door without an existing deadbolt. It took a few hours to cut the holes and line everything up correctly, but I am not a professional. Once the holes were in place, the install and set up was quick. I like this deadbolt because it has an alarm if someone tries to force the door open. The codes can be 4-6 digits long. I have not used the smart features yet, but I have given my siblings and parents different codes. Theoretically, with the smart hub, I should be able to tell which family member stopped in, and when. The smart hub is next on the agenda for install.
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: Schlage Connect is a great lock and works well with the wink hub
customer_reviews.text: lock works great. I am using it with a Wink hub and it can activate other wink devices using the hub. (using wink robots to control lights) The Lock looks well built and was not too hard to install. There are a lot of electronic options, you can choose password length and the lock even has a built in alarm. It is a bit complex to setup I would recommend this lock the Schlage Connect Camelot Touchscreen Deadbolt
customer_reviews.author: Ben H

customer_reviews.title: beware.  doesnt always lock!
customer_reviews.text: I like the freedom from the key. especially for my kids who loose theirs all the time(the whole neighborhood probably had keys to our house) However there are HUGE issues with this lock. 1) ot spunds like it locks but it doesnt. 2) can not get the app to work with it. 3) it sometimes says the wrong code was entered even with the right numbers lighting up when pushed.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: ( Pretty easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Interfaces with Samsung SmartThing Hub and Android phone, but not with Amazon Echo :( Pretty easy to install, however, the screws provided by Schlage are substandard. I had to buy good quality screws to install. First lock installed I had three screws snap off causing a huge install problem. Learned from the next two that I installed and they went very well.
customer_reviews.author: KTL

customer_reviews.title: Battery die in a month and poor customer services
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace battery once a month. At first I thought it was normal until I found normally people don't need to replace battery for one year. I tried all different ways such as factory reset and disable sounds etc. Nothing worked. Called customer service and no one pick up after 30 minutes. I guess there are too many upset customers? Wrote them an email a week ago, no reply.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Simply enjoying my new lock. Now I can lock ...
customer_reviews.text: Simply enjoying my new lock. Now I can lock and unlock without being home and send a temporary access code to certain person. No more getting myself lock out of the house (LOL). The only down side is I need to get a hub to connect with the lock so I can remotely control the lock which I'm ok with. As for the installation, I didn't do it by myself (since it's front door, i'm afraid if I will have problem with installation or install it right) so I can't review on it. I had the amazon team came out to install which is totally worth it for me. They are quick and make things a lot smooth.
customer_reviews.author: CC

product_meta.title: Schlage Z-Wave Connect Camelot Touchscreen Deadbolt with Built-In Alarm, Satin Nickel, BE469 CAM 619, Works with Alexa via SmartThings, Wink or Iris
product_meta.description: Color:Satin Nickel| Style:CamelotFrom your smartphone to your car, you want advanced technology that makes life simpler. Technology that can keep up with everything life throws at it. With Schlage connect, we’ve brought that level of thinking to your door locks. Schlage connect combines all of our best security features into one lock - redefining what it means to be secure. With a sleek, modern touchscreen, you have the convenience of going keyless and no longer having keys to lose, hide, carry or forget. The fingerprint-resistant touchscreen ensures numbers won’t be detectable to intruders after repeated use - safeguarding your home even more. And thanks to Z-Wave technology, Schlage connect gives you advanced remote management capabilities and compatibility with home monitoring systems - letting you run your home from anywhere." Operating Temperatures: Outside escutcheon: -35C to 66C,Inside escutcheon: -10C to 49C
feature_bullets: Works with Alexa for voice control (hub required, Alexa device and hub sold separately)
Touch Screen keypad and lock cylinder on exterior and thumb turn interior. Door thickness range is 1.37 to 1.75 standard
Stores up to 30 personalized user codes at a time
Z wave technology connects to your home automation system and lets you lock or unlock your door remotely via the web or smartphone.Volts:6 V
Battery operated and fit standard door prep
Durable Resistive Touchscreen with matte finish to protect against fingerprints and smudges
Built in alarm with 3 alert settings. Battery Uses 4 AA alkaline batteries. Exterior Dimensions 3 x 5 x 1 inches. Interior Dimensions 3 x 8 x 2 inches

specifications.Included Components: Schlage Connect Camelot Touchscreen Deadbolt With Built-In Alarm, User Guide, Schlage Connect Deadbolt, 4-Aa Batteries, Be469 Cam 619, Installation Instructions, Satin Nickel, 1-Back-Up Key
specifications.Warranty Description: Lifetime Limited Mechanical & Finish and 1-Year Warranty
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars4,480 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
